content.text: is designed to process and merge split meter billing records into a summary table,

. It uses a cursor to iterate over temporary split transactions and updates the summary table with merged data. The procedure handles records that span multiple billing periods and ensures that the data is consolidated correctly. It also manages the deletion of reset meter records once they are merged.
The complexity of this stored procedure is medium due to the following factors:
It involves multiple SQL operations, including updates, inserts, and deletes.
It uses a cursor to iterate over records, which adds complexity in terms of control flow.
It involves joining multiple tables and views to fetch and update data.
The logic for merging and updating records is intricate, involving conditional checks and updates.
This stored procedure does not take any input parameters. It operates on predefined tables and views within the
: The procedure begins by declaring variables to hold sequence IDs and other necessary data.
using data from a view that determines overrides based on date criteria.
to prepare it for new data.
is declared and opened to iterate over the temporary split transactions.
For each record, it updates the
table with merged data from a view.
It checks if the update was successful and deletes the reset meter record if it was merged.
: After processing all records, it updates any remaining records in
is zero, setting it to one.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance bottlenecks, especially if the dataset is large. Cursors process rows one at a time, which is less efficient than set-based operations.
is efficient for clearing the table but assumes that no concurrent operations require the data.
: Ensure that the tables involved, especially those frequently joined or updated, are properly indexed to improve query performance.
: Consider processing records in batches if the dataset is large to reduce transaction log growth and improve performance.
: The procedure does not handle concurrency explicitly. If multiple instances run simultaneously, it could lead to data inconsistencies or deadlocks.
: There is minimal error handling. If an update fails, it only prints a message. Consider implementing robust error handling and logging.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the views and tables is accurate and consistent. Any discrepancies could lead to incorrect merges.
: As the volume of data grows, the use of cursors and lack of batch processing could impact scalability and performance.
), which may need adjustments based on business rules or requirements changes.

-- =============================================
-- Author:		<Author,,Name>
-- Create date: <Create Date,,>
-- Description:	<Description,,>
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [ConEd].[usp_Upload_11_ProcessSplitMeterBilling]
AS 
    BEGIN
	
	
	 /*
	process split records and put them into ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary. This is achieved by 
	using cursor on temporary staging table called UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned 
	*/


        BEGIN
            DECLARE @TempSplitTransactionsSeqid INT
            DECLARE @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid INT
            DECLARE @Notes dbo.notes
            DECLARE @Success INT
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************
--
-- Find UploadConEdAccountSummary reset rows that would override UploadConEdMeterSummary
-- billing revision period.  The criteria is the UploadConEdMeterSummary.ToDate is greater
-- than the UploadConEdAccountSummary.FromDate and is less than and equal to the UploadConEdAccountSummary.ToDate
--
--
            UPDATE  ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
            SET     BillingPeriodRevision = ConEd.uvw_UploadConEdAccountSummaryOverrideMeterSummaryBillingRevisionPeriod.AccountBillingPeriodRevision
            FROM ConEd.uvw_UploadConEdAccountSummaryOverrideMeterSummaryBillingRevisionPeriod
                    INNER JOIN ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary ON ConEd.uvw_UploadConEdAccountSummaryOverrideMeterSummaryBillingRevisionPeriod.UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid = ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid                      
-- 
-- Once the override is completed.  Find all of the split transactions that need to be merged with the reset
-- row.  Assume that the number of billing days are less than 30.
--
            TRUNCATE TABLE ConEd.TempSplitTransactions

            INSERT  INTO ConEd.TempSplitTransactions
                    ( UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid ,
                      AccountUtilityCompanySeqid ,
                      AccountBilled ,
                      MeterBilled ,
                      AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid ,
                      AdjustedMeterBilling ,
                      AdjustedMeterBillingElectric ,
                      OriginalAccountNumber ,
                      OriginalMeterNumber ,
                      BillingPeriod ,
                      BillingPeriodRevision ,
                      FirstCancelPeriod ,
                      NumberOfTransactions ,
                      NumberOfRebillTransactions ,
                      NumberOfCancelTransactions ,
                      BillingAction ,
                      PriorRevisedBilledCCF ,
                      RevisedBilledCCF ,
                      CanceledBilledCCF ,
                      PriorRevisedBilledTherms ,
                      RevisedBilledTherms ,
                      CanceledBilledTherms ,
                      InitialCancelFromDate ,
                      CurrentBillingToDate ,
                      GasRateCode ,
                      FromDate ,
                      ToDate ,
                      MeterFromReading ,
                      MeterToReading ,
                      Ccf ,
                      Therms ,
                      ThermsFactor ,
                      MeterConstant ,
                      TotalBillingDaysRebilled ,
                      NumberOfBillingPeriods ,
                      AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge ,
                      AverageRebillThermsFactor ,
                      BillingDays ,
                      BillingDate ,
                      ReadingCode ,
                      NumberOfDials ,
                      MeterType ,
                      ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod ,
                      ProcessEffectiveDate ,
                      CancelReadingCode ,
                      CancelFromDate ,
                      CancelToDate ,
                      CancelMeterFromReading ,
                      CancelMeterToReading ,
                      CancelCcf ,
                      CancelTherms ,
                      CancelThermsFactor ,
                      CancelMeterConstant ,
                      InitialPostingDate ,
                      DerivedFromSpannedBill ,
                      SpannedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                      SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod ,
                      SpannedCCF ,
                      SpannedThermFactor ,
                      SpannedTherm ,
                      SpannedMonthlyPercentage ,
                      SpannedTotalPercentage ,
                      EstimatedOrActualBilling ,
                      FacilityName ,
                      ServiceAddress ,
                      AuthenticatedUserID ,
                      Notes ,
                      DateAdded ,
                      LastUpdate
                    )
                    SELECT  UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid ,
                            AccountUtilityCompanySeqid ,
                            AccountBilled ,
                            MeterBilled ,
                            AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid ,
                            AdjustedMeterBilling ,
                            AdjustedMeterBillingElectric ,
                            OriginalAccountNumber ,
                            OriginalMeterNumber ,
                            BillingPeriod ,
                            BillingPeriodRevision ,
                            FirstCancelPeriod ,
                            NumberOfTransactions ,
                            NumberOfRebillTransactions ,
                            NumberOfCancelTransactions ,
                            BillingAction ,
                            PriorRevisedBilledCCF ,
                            RevisedBilledCCF ,
                            CanceledBilledCCF ,
                            PriorRevisedBilledTherms ,
                            RevisedBilledTherms ,
                            CanceledBilledTherms ,
                            InitialCancelFromDate ,
                            CurrentBillingToDate ,
                            GasRateCode ,
                            FromDate ,
                            ToDate ,
                            MeterFromReading ,
                            MeterToReading ,
                            Ccf ,
                            Therms ,
                            ThermsFactor ,
                            MeterConstant ,
                            TotalBillingDaysRebilled ,
                            NumberOfBillingPeriods ,
                            AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge ,
                            AverageRebillThermsFactor ,
                            BillingDays ,
                            BillingDate ,
                            ReadingCode ,
                            NumberOfDials ,
                            MeterType ,
                            ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod ,
                            ProcessEffectiveDate ,
                            CancelReadingCode ,
                            CancelFromDate ,
                            CancelToDate ,
                            CancelMeterFromReading ,
                            CancelMeterToReading ,
                            CancelCcf ,
                            CancelTherms ,
                            CancelThermsFactor ,
                            CancelMeterConstant ,
                            InitialPostingDate ,
                            DerivedFromSpannedBill ,
                            SpannedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                            SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod ,
                            SpannedCCF ,
                            SpannedThermFactor ,
                            SpannedTherm ,
                            SpannedMonthlyPercentage ,
                            SpannedTotalPercentage ,
                            EstimatedOrActualBilling ,
                            FacilityName ,
                            ServiceAddress ,
                            AuthenticatedUserID ,
                            Notes ,
                            DateAdded ,
                            LastUpdate
                    FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                    WHERE   ( MeterFromReading = 0 )
                            AND ( MeterToReading <> 0 )
                            AND BillingDays < 30
                    ORDER BY NumberOfBillingPeriods
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--Main Process                                      
--**************************************************************************************
--
--	DECLARE a cursor to find all account bills that span more than one period.
--
            DECLARE SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor CURSOR
            FOR
                SELECT  TempSplitTransactionsSeqid ,
                        UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid
                FROM ConEd.TempSplitTransactions 
--
            OPEN SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor;
--
-- @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid holds the id of the reset meter records which will be deleted once the data is merged
-- and the notes are created
--
            FETCH NEXT FROM SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor INTO @TempSplitTransactionsSeqid,
                @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid
--
-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.

            WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 
                BEGIN
	--
	--	Fetch a split row to process 
	--
	--	Find the split row to conterpart by joining the view and split table.
	--			ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo 
	--			ConEd.TempSplitTransactions 	
	--	WHERE (ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.MeterFromReading <> '0') updates the 
	--	the merged data record with the complete summary totals for the period.
	--
                    UPDATE  ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                    SET     FromDate = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationFromDate ,
                            ToDate = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationToDate ,
                            CurrentBillingToDate = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationToDate ,
                            MeterFromReading = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterFromReading,
                                                      0) ,
                            MeterToReading = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterToReading,
                                                    0) ,
                            Ccf = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.TotalCCF,
                                         0) ,
                            Therms = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.TotalTherms,
                                            0) ,
                            ThermsFactor = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.ThermsFactor,
                                                  1.03) ,
                            MeterConstant = ISNULL(ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterConstant,
                                                   1) ,
							Notes = 
							left(
							(Common.MeterResetNotes('M',
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationFromDate,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationMeterFromReading,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationToDate,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationMeterToReading,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationCCF,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationThermsFactor,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationTherms,
                                                           ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterMergeInformationMeterConstant)
                            + '--' + Common.MeterResetNotes('R',
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationFromDate,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterFromReading,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationToDate,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterToReading,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationCCF,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationThermsFactor,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationTherms,
                                                            ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.MeterResetInformationMeterConstant))
							, 300)


                    FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                            INNER JOIN ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo ON ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.BillingPeriod = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.BillingPeriod
                                                              AND ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.BillingPeriodRevision = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.BillingPeriodRevision
                                                              AND ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.OriginalAccountNumber = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.OriginalAccountNumber
                                                              AND ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary.OriginalMeterNumber = ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.OriginalMeterNumber
                    WHERE   ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.TempSplitTransactionsSeqid = @TempSplitTransactionsSeqid
                            AND ConEd.uvw_MergeSplitBillingAndMeterResetsUploadConEdisonMeterInfo.UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid
	--
                    SET @Success = @@rowcount
	--
	-- Complete the processing by deleteing the reset meter row from the ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary table since it was already merged.
	--
                    IF ( @Success > 0 ) 
                        DELETE  FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                        WHERE   ( UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid )
                    ELSE 
                        PRINT 'Update failed for UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid Seqid'
                            + CAST(@UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid AS VARCHAR(10))
                            + ' - TempSplitTransactionsSeqid'
                            + CAST(@TempSplitTransactionsSeqid AS VARCHAR(10))
	--
	--	Process the next row
	--
                    FETCH NEXT FROM SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor INTO @TempSplitTransactionsSeqid,
                        @UploadConEdisonMeterSummarySeqid
                END

            CLOSE SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor;
            DEALLOCATE SplitBillingAndMeterResetsCursor;
--
-- Remove the splits from the ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary after the merge
--
            UPDATE  ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
            SET     NumberOfBillingPeriods = 1 ,
                    Notes = 'Zero number of billing periods set to one to process as a whole period not a merged split'
            WHERE   ( NumberOfBillingPeriods = 0 )
                    AND ( Ccf <> 0 )
  
        END -- 2 ends  
    
   

    END
